intro: Ficinia ixioides subsp. glabra, commonly known as the smooth sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are smooth to the touch, as indicated by its subspecies name "glabra." Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually clustered in spikelets, and it produces small, three-lobed berries. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
